member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.SubscribeMarketData(StockSharp.Messages.MarketDataMessage,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.GenericFieldTypes},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method to request market data. The market data will be returned by the tickPrice, tickSize, tickOptionComputation(), tickGeneric(), tickString() and tickEFP() methods.
member.param: this structure contains a description of the contract for which market data is being requested.
comma delimited list of generic tick types. Tick types can be found here: (new Generic Tick Types page).
Allows client to request snapshot market data.
Market Data Off - used in conjunction with RTVolume Generic tick type causes only volume data to be sent.

.
.
.
.
.
.
. .
To get data only by the trading time. By default the trading time is used.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.ExerciseOptions(StockSharp.Messages.OrderRegisterMessage,System.Boolean,System.Decimal,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call the exerciseOptions() method to exercise options. “SMART” is not an allowed exchange in exerciseOptions() calls, and that TWS does a moneyness request for the position in question whenever any API initiated exercise or lapse is attempted.
member.param: this structure contains a description of the contract to be exercised. If no multiplier is specified, a default of 100 is assumed.
this can have two values: 1 = specifies exercise 2 = specifies lapse.
the number of contracts to be exercised.

specifies whether your setting will override the system's natural action. For example, if your action is "exercise" and the option is not in-the-money, by natural action the option would not exercise. If you have override set to "yes" the natural action would be overridden and the out-of-the money option would be exercised. Values are: 0 = no 1 = yes.

specifies whether your setting will override the system's natural action. For example, if your action is "exercise" and the option is not in-the-money, by natural action the option would not exercise. If you have override set to "yes" the natural action would be overridden and the out-of-the money option would be exercised. Values are: 0 = no 1 = yes.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.SubscribePortfolio(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this function to start getting account values, portfolio, and last update time information.
member.param: If set to , the client will start receiving account and portfolio updates. If set to , the client will stop receiving this information.
the account code for which to receive account and portfolio updates.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.ReqeustMyTrades(System.Int64,StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.MyTradeFilter)
member.summary: When this method is called, the execution reports that meet the filter criteria are downloaded to the client via the execDetails() method.
member.param: the filter criteria used to determine which execution reports are returned.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.RequestOpenOrders
member.summary: Call this method to request the open orders that were placed from this client. Each open order will be fed back through the openOrder() and orderStatus() functions on the EWrapper. The client with a clientId of "0" will also receive the TWS-owned open orders. These orders will be associated with the client and a new orderId will be generated. This association will persist over multiple API and TWS sessions.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.RequestAutoOpenOrders(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this method to request that newly created TWS orders be implicitly associated with the client. When a new TWS order is created, the order will be associated with the client and fed back through the openOrder() and orderStatus() methods on the EWrapper. TWS orders can only be bound to clients with a clientId of “0”.
member.param: If set to , newly created TWS orders will be implicitly associated with the client. If set to , no association will be made.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.RequestAllOpenOrders
member.summary: Call this method to request the open orders that were placed from all clients and also from TWS. Each open order will be fed back through the openOrder() and orderStatus() functions on the EWrapper. No association is made between the returned orders and the requesting client.

member.name: M:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.InteractiveBrokersMessageAdapter.RequestPortfolios
member.summary: Call this method to request the list of managed accounts. The list will be returned by the managedAccounts() function on the EWrapper. This request can only be made when connected to a Financial Advisor (FA) account.

member.summary: Market data fields, which will be received with subscribed to Level1 messages.

member.name: F:StockSharp.InteractiveBrokers.Native.FieldTypes.Halted
member.summary: When trading is halted for a contract, TWS receives a special tick: haltedLast=1. When trading is resumed, TWS receives haltedLast=0. A new tick type, HALTED, tick ID = 49, is now available in regular market data via the API to indicate this halted state. Possible values for this new tick type are: 0 = Not halted 1 = Halted.
